org.smtlib

Interface ISource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Pos.Source

    public interface ISource
    This interface represents sources of characters. The source need not be fully available at any given time, but it does need to be able to supply characters at a given position on demand and to determine line numbers from the beginning of the source.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char charAt(int pos)
      Returns the character at the given character position within the source.
      java.lang.CharSequence chars()
      The internal character stream as a CharSequence.
      void close()
      Closes any open resources - the source is not usable after this call.
      int lineBeginning(int pos)
      Returns the character position of the beginning of the line containing the given position.
      int lineNumber(int pos)
      Returns the number (beginning with 1) of the line containing the given character position (which begins at 0).
      java.lang.Object location()
      User-specified identification of the location of the source; the user is responsible to use the result in the way in which the source object was created.
      java.lang.String textLine(int pos)
      Returns the text of the line containing the given position, at least through the given position, and always ending with a (perhaps added) line termination sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • chars

        java.lang.CharSequence chars()
        The internal character stream as a CharSequence. We would like to avoid the constraint of having to have this kind of internal representation, but the parser uses Pattern and Matcher, which require a CharSequence. The CharSequence might not contain all the characters that might ever be read, but will contain characters as they are read.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes any open resources - the source is not usable after this call.

      • location

        java.lang.Object location()
        User-specified identification of the location of the source; the user is responsible to use the result in the way in which the source object was created.
        Returns:
        the location object of the source

      • charAt

        char charAt(int pos)
        Returns the character at the given character position within the source. Character positions begin at 0.

      • lineBeginning

        int lineBeginning(int pos)
        Returns the character position of the beginning of the line containing the given position. Character positions begin at 0.

      • textLine

        java.lang.String textLine(int pos)
        Returns the text of the line containing the given position, at least through the given position, and always ending with a (perhaps added) line termination sequence. Character positions begin at 0.
        Parameters:
        pos - a character position
        Returns:
        the line of text containing that character position

      • lineNumber

        int lineNumber(int pos)
        Returns the number (beginning with 1) of the line containing the given character position (which begins at 0).
